description.narrative: The commitment covers two aspects of the Danish support for P4G: a) the establishment of a coordination hub anchored in WRI and b) a P4G partnership fund

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Platforms for knowledge exchange and communication of partnership solutions established

Output indicators: a. Number of annual visitors to the P4G website and pageviews. b. Number of annual subscribers to the P4G newsletter and level of engage-ment as measured by open rates. c. Visibility and level of attendance of P4G’s annual State-of-the-Art Partner-ship awards d. No. of active P4G Learning Communities facilitating knowledge exchange

target.value: a. 31.000 unique web visitors. 123.000 pageviews b. 2.193 subscribers. average open rate of 31% (20% is considered good) c. Awards attended by 700 high-level business. government and civil society leaders attending P4G Summit; Danish Crown Princess Mary presented the winner the award; broadcast live on Danish TV; social media coverage of winner d. One Learning Community per (P4G relevant) SDG well-functioning and spurring ideas across P4G partnerships

a. 30% annual growth in website visitors and pageviews b. 30% annual growth of newsletter subscribers and open rate of 25-30% c. Awards event held in NYC during UN General Assembly meetings with estimated audience of 200 leaders and media coverage of the winner d. One Learning Community per (P4G relevant) SDG well-functioning and spurring ideas across P4G partnerships

a. 30% growth in annual web visitors and pageviews b. 30% growth in annual newsletter subscribers and an open rate of 25-30% c. Awards event held in conjunction with 2022 P4G Summit. providing high-visibility venue. d. One Learning Community per (P4G relevant) SDG well-functioning and spurring ideas across P4G partnerships

a. 30% growth year-over-year b. 30% growth year-over-year and open rate of 25-30% c. Awards event held on sidelines of UN Climate Action Summit attracts 175 high-level attendees and the partnership of the year winner attracts media and social media coverage d. One Learning Community per (P4G relevant) SDG well-functioning and spurring ideas across P4G partnerships

actual.value: a. Achieved b. Achieved c. Achieved d. In progress

target.value: a. 30% annual growth of website visits and pageviews b. 30% annual growth in newsletter subscribers and open rate of 25-30% c. Awards event tied to 2020 P4G Summit. providing high-level visibility and media coverage d. One Learning Community per (P4G relevant) SDG well-functioning and spurring ideas across P4G partnerships

actual.value: a. Not Achieved – but added one new social media platform and saw more than 54% growth on LinkedIn and 18% on Twitter b. Target Exceeded for newsletter growth 2020 growth rate was 41.3%. Target Achieved for Open Rate 29% c. Elevated the State-of-the-Art Awards and enhanced their visibility with an alternate event due to Summit postponement d. Achieved

title.narrative: P4G contributes to accelerating the partnership projects

Output indicators: a. No of partnerships with acceleration plans successfully implemented (Tier 1 and Tier 2) b. No. of partnerships that indicate that P4G has helped accelerate the partnership in a relevant way (network, investors, recognition, technical advise etc.)

target.value: a. All scale-up partnerships b. All scale-up partnerships and 50% of start-ups
a. All scale-up partnerships b. All scale-up partnerships and 50% of start-ups
a. All scale-up partnerships b. All scale-up partnerships and 50% of start-ups
a. All scale-up partnerships b. All scale-up partnerships and 50% of start-ups

actual.value: a. Achieved b. All scale-up partnerships and 93% of start-up partnerships active in 2020

target.value: a. All scale-up partnerships b. All scale-up partnerships and 50% of start-ups

actual.value: a. All 2018 scale-up partnerships b. See data from Q2 2020

title.narrative: State-of-the-Art Report published to inspire and spur learning

Output indicators: a. P4G State-of-the-Art reports and other learning materials produced and level of dissemination b. Number of citations of P4G State-of-the-Art reports in media stories and other research publications as tracked by Google Scholar

target.value: a. No report b. N/A
a. No report b. N/A
a. No report b. 2020 report receives 8 new media mentions and 4-6 new research citations.

a. P4G State-of-the-Art report and related products produced. Report down-loaded/viewed 2.500 times during first full-year of publication b. Report attracts 25-35 global media mentions and 5-8 research citations in the first year of its release.

a. P4G State-of-the-Art report and other side products produced. Report downloaded/viewed 2.000 times during first full year of publication. b. Report generates 15-20 media mentions globally. and 2-3 citations in first full year

actual.value: a. State of the Art Report produced. Report downloaded/viewed 1,884 times to date b. 0 mentions, 0 citations

title.narrative: P4G Summits and Annual Meetings implemented

Output indicators: a. Summits on track (organised, implemented and well attended) b. Summit programme accommodates room for concrete and tangible acceler-ation of partnerships c. Convene annual P4G meeting between Summit years involving P4G part-nerships and network

target.value: a. P4G Summit organised in Copenhagen with high level participation by all P4G partner countries. P4G partners organisations. and businesses (700+ attendees) b. P4G Partnerships report that participation in the Summit was relevant and valuable c. N/A

a. Host country for 2022 P4G Summit selected and planning on target b. Planning of summit is based on ideas and input from partnerships c. Convene annual P4G meeting involving P4G partnerships and network

a. P4G Summit organised with high level participation by all P4G partner countries. P4G partners organisations. and businesses b. P4G Partnerships report that participation in the Summit was relevant and valuable c. N/A

a. Host country for 2020 P4G Summit selected and planning on target b. Planning of summit is based on ideas and input from partnerships and learnings from 2018 Summit c. Convene annual P4G meeting involving P4G partnerships and network

actual.value: a. Achieved b. On track c. Achieved

target.value: a. P4G Summit organised with high level participation by all P4G partner countries. P4G partners organisations. and businesses b. P4G Partnerships report that participation in the Summit was relevant and valuable c. N/A

actual.value: a. Not Achieved – postponed to 2021 due to COVID-19 b. Not Achieved c. Hosted in place of postponed Summit (indicator: Convene annual P4G meeting between Summit years involving P4G partnerships and network)

title.narrative: P4G National Platforms established and actively engaging in the P4G agenda at national level
Output indicators: a. No. of NPs established b. % of national partnerships in which the NP engages c. National platform gathering

target.value: a. Platforms established in Denmark. Kenya. Ethiopia. Vietnam and Republic of Korea b. NA c. 1 National Platform gathering planned and executed
a. 10 NPs operating. Possible additional NPs launched (TBD) b. NPs engage in 80% of the partnerships in the respective partner countries c. 1 National Platform gathering planned and executed
a. 10 NPs operating. Possible additional NPs launched (TBD) b. NPs engage in 80% of the partnerships in the respective partner countries c. 1 National Platform gathering planned and executed

a. 8 NPs operating. 2 additional NPs launched (Possibly Indonesia. Bangla-desh and South Africa) b. NPs engage in 70% of the partnerships in the respective partner countries c. 1 National Platform gathering planned and executed

actual.value: a. 7 NPs operating, 2 launched b. CO: 100%, ET: 100%, ID: 100%, KE: 88%, MX: 100%, VN: 0% c. 1

target.value: a. Platforms established in Colombia. Mexico and Netherlands b. NPs engage in 50% of the partnerships in the respective partner countries c. 1 National Platform gathering planned and executed

title.narrative: Intermediary outcome B: Key actors use knowledge and learning from testing of green and inclusive solutions

Outcome indicators: a. Percentage of scale-up partnerships that refine and mature their models and approaches based on knowledge derived from P4G. b. Amplification of promising ideas derived from P4G partnerships beyond the P4G network. c. Number of funded scale-up partnerships that participate actively in the learning communities

target.value: a. 100% of P4G scale-up partnerships b. 3-5 good cases documented from each application round c. 80% of all funded scale-up partnerships

title.narrative: Main outcome: Innovative market-based solutions within the five P4G SDGs are tested, proven and ready for scale and replication

Outcome indicators: a. Percentage of P4G scale-up partnerships that contribute to successful solu-tions/models ready for replication and scale b. Percentage of P4G scale-up partnerships where commercial partners have committed financial contribution (not in-kind) c. Sufficient number of quality applications (could be approved for funding) for start-up and scale-up partnerships

target.value: a. 40% for both market-driven and market-generating partnerships b. 70% of P4G scale-up partnerships c. Receipt of twice as many quality applications (on Global Hub’s ‘Medium list’) as available funding allows (start-up and scale-up)

title.narrative: Intermediate ouctome A: Key actors from government, civil society and business act collabora-tively to enable implementation of green and inclusive solutions
Outcome indicators: a. High-level commitment by P4G network to the partnerships b. High-level of engagement in Board meetings and Summits

target.value: a. Relevant P4G network members contribute to accelerate start-up and scale-up partnerships b. High level engagement in and follow up from all Board meetings and Sum-mits

title.narrative: P4G Partnership Fund established and functining

Output indicators: a. No of start-up partnerships funded b. No of scale-up partnerships funded c. Percentage of partnerships funded that have successfully implemented project activities and achieved the expected results.

target.value: a. 7-10 start-up b. 3-5 scale-up including possible reapplication grants c. 70% of partnerships funded in 2021.
a. 7-10 start-up b. 3-5 scale-up including possible reapplication grants c. 70% of partnerships funded 2022.
a. 11 start-up b. 6 scale-up c. 70% of partnerships funded in 2018.
a. 7-10 start-up b. 3-5 scale-up including possible reapplication grants c. 70% of partnerships funded in 2020.
a. 7-10 start-up b. 3-5 scale-up c. 70% of partnerships funded in 2019.
